content: Using copyrighted datasets for AI training is fair use and doesn't constitute infringement
AI-generated content should be eligible for copyright protection
The use of copyrighted material in AI training is transformative and should be permitted
Ownership of AI-generated work is clear: it belongs to the AI's creator or operator
AI models enhance and inspire artists rather than infringe on their rights
Monetization of AI-generated content is ethical and should be encouraged
Existing IP laws are sufficient to handle AI-generated works
AI can be trained on protected work as it falls under fair use
Lenient regulations on AI are necessary for technological progress
AI-generated content can be highly original and deserving of copyright
Intellectual property use in ML training datasets is transformative and legal
AI training on copyrighted data benefits society and should be permitted
Current copyright laws are adequate for AI-generated works
AI companies shouldn't need to compensate artists for using publicly available work in training
Open-source AI models promote innovation and benefit society
